image.altText: A young boy holds a knitted toy octopus.

props.synopsis: More than 6,000 gifts are made each year by the charity Good Omen Goodeze. For patients like Zyan, these knitted toys are more than fun — they’re therapeutic.

title.children: When 4yo Zyan was in pain, a blue knitted octopus kept him calm

image.altText: A man with short grey hair wearing a dark blue suit and glasses walks outside a court building looking serious.

props.synopsis: Former ACT attorney-general Gordon Ramsay has been suspended without pay from his role as CEO of the Cultural Facilities Corporation while he faces charges for grooming a teenager.

title.children: Former ACT politician suspended from role amid grooming charges

image.altText: The sign at the tip says "transfer station".

props.synopsis: ACT police say the man was hit by the truck and knocked into the rubbish collection area, suffering fatal injuries.

title.children: Man dies after being hit by reversing truck at Canberra tip

image.altText: A black and white photo of two men in slouched hats

props.synopsis: It started a researcher down a rabbit hole "beyond anything anyone could ever dream up", involving deception, double agents, secret names and plans for a genocide.

title.children: The Australian POWs who became double agents and uncovered genocidal plans

image.altText: A close up shot of a man with white hair wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The former military lawyer was sentenced to five years and eight months in jail after sharing classified material with journalists in a case that has raised debate about whistleblower laws.

title.children: David McBride loses last-ditch effort to overturn conviction

image.altText: David Pocock playing parliamentary sport.

props.synopsis: The former star Wallabies player turned independent senator was kicked out of the social sports club after raising concerns about its links to the gambling industry.

title.children: Pocock reinvited to parliamentary sports club after PM weighs in

image.altText: Ravi bends his knees to lift the weight, standing in the gym.

props.synopsis: Ravi Sood turned to the gym to help build muscle before a knee replacement. It has changed his life and led him to the World Masters Powerlifting Championships.

title.children: 82yo man headed to world powerlifting championships

image.altText: Football specatators watch a game on a foggy day

props.synopsis: In the Yarriambiack Shire, 350 kilometres from Melbourne in Victoria's rural north-west, virtually all of the towns are shrinking.

title.children: A quarter of this town's population has vanished. Experts say that could be terminal

image.altText: A man at home in a Richmond AFL jumper, his face painted yellow and black and wearing a black wig.

props.synopsis: Diehard Richmond fan "Tiger Shaun" says he's watched on in horror as gambling advertising and sponsorships have come to dominate football — and become a constant reminder of the addiction he has struggled with.

title.children: 'Gambling advertising needs to go, and it needs to go now': Footy fan's plea

image.altText: A white plane wing with  red tip

props.synopsis: Hackers have released personal data from Qantas customers onto the dark web, following a cyber attack in July.

title.children: Qantas customers' data leaked to dark web after cyber attack

image.altText: Household grocery items including milk, toilet paper, instant coffee and eggs.

props.synopsis: Last month, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese invited Emirati hypermarket chain LuLu Group to compete with Coles and Woolworths for market share. But some retail experts say entry into Australia's supermarket sector isn't so simple.

title.children: Could a new supermarket chain solve Australia's grocery woes?

image.altText: platypus swimming in water

props.synopsis: Almost 190 years on, in the place where Charles Darwin first spotted a platypus, the egg-laying mammal seems to have disappeared.

title.children: Platypus vanish from river where Charles Darwin pondered evolution

image.altText: Concept design for the new Women's and Children's Hospital at Thebarton Barracks.

props.synopsis: The Malinauskas government has become well-versed in the language of cost blowouts, and the $3.2 billion Women's and Children's Hospital is another chance for it to flex its vocabulary.

title.children: The question hanging over SA's biggest health project

image.altText: A woman works on a wedding dress on a mannequin with wedding dresses on hangers behind her.

props.synopsis: Chinese Australian women are paying thousands of dollars to find love on matchmaking platforms in Australia, but behind the glossy promotions lies a different reality.

title.children: 'Why marry at all?' Woman upset at matchmaking service

image.altText: Tom in a blue suit and tie with his arms crossed. He stares at the camera. The Hard Quiz Kids logo is in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Hard Quiz Kids is back. The more basic questions should be right up your alley.

title.children: Dream of trivia glory? Let's play, HARD!

image.altText: Michael Storer smiles and holds his arms in the air while standing on the podium

props.synopsis: Perth's Michael Storer becomes the first Australian to make the Tour of Lombardy podium in 39 years, but he still can't live with the amazing Tadej Pogačar.

title.children: Storer makes Aussie cycling history but is no match for Pogačar at Il Lombardia

image.altText: Supercars drive towards Mount Panorama

props.synopsis: The 2025 Bathurst 1000 starts on Sunday morning. Here's all you need to know before the 68th running of the iconic endurance race.

title.children: What time is the Bathurst 1000?

image.altText: Joe Biden sitting at his office desk in the white house

props.synopsis: The spokesperson added the radiation treatment is expected to continue for five weeks and is a new stage in his level of care.

title.children: Joe Biden undergoing radiation therapy for prostate cancer

image.altText: an automated entry exit system display and a fingerprint scanner

props.synopsis: A new entry/exit system will require all non-European Union citizens to register their personal details, including fingerprints and facial images.

title.children: Travelling to Europe soon? You will be fingerprinted on arrival

image.altText: shellharbour plane crash 1

props.synopsis: Officers from Lake Illawarra Police District were informed that a light aircraft crashed shortly after take-off on Saturday morning.

title.children: 'No chance of being saved': Three killed in NSW plane crash

image.altText: A mother in a warm cardigan stands in a well lit kitchen, carefully holding a mug of tea.

props.synopsis: Researchers are trying to fix the "Western bias" contained in many DNA databases with a new national project targeting multicultural communities.

title.children: 'Heavily biased': Who's missing from our DNA databases?

image.altText: Building with thick white steam coming out

props.synopsis: A power supply agreement between Australia's only producer of newsprint, which is used in newspapers, and Tasmania's state-owned energy retailer is reached.

title.children: Stalemate broken as Australia's last paper mill secures power deal

image.altText: Trump sitting across Netanyahu.

props.synopsis: In the tragic arc of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, Donald Trump may have closed the latest — and most violent — chapter.

title.children: Trump has strong-armed Netanyahu, who was planning a longer war

image.altText: A group of protesters hold placards and signs.

props.synopsis: Israel's Ministry of Justice provides the names of prisoners it will release in exchange for Israeli hostages, but Hamas says no agreement has been reached.

title.children: Israel publishes names of 250 Palestinian prisoners to be freed

image.altText: A person in dark clothing holding a long edged weapon.

props.synopsis: Investigators say a brawl between two groups armed with machetes spilled into a shopping centre in Broadmeadows on Friday night.

title.children: Police investigate machete brawl at Melbourne shopping centre

image.altText: A mbald man sitting a computer witha colourful display of data on the screen.

props.synopsis: University of Queensland researcher Arutha Kulasinghe studied lung biopsies from the tumours of almost 250 patients with non-small cell lung cancer across Australia, the United States and Europe.

title.children: A life dedicated to cancer research leads to 'revolutionary' finding

image.altText: A purple NDIS sign on the side of an office building.

props.synopsis: Proceedings began against the now-defunct provider following the death of a Queensland participant in 2023. The penalty is the highest civil sanction imposed on an NDIS provider to date.

title.children: NDIS provider fined $2.2m after man killed walking into highway traffic

image.altText: A dingo on K'gari (Fraser Island) on December 18.

props.synopsis: A Queensland Ambulance Service spokesperson says the boy was treated for bites and cuts to his head near Coolooloi Creek on Saturday afternoon.

title.children: Boy flown to hospital after dingo attack on K'gari

image.altText: Brodie Kostecki and Todd Hazelwood celebrating taking pole position at Bathurst 1000.

props.synopsis: Brodie Kostecki claims pole at the Bathurst 1000, becoming just the third driver in Supercars history to start at the top of the grid three years in a row.

title.children: Defending champ Kostecki takes historic Bathurst 1000 pole

image.altText: a large intelligence surveillance aircraft flies over green land

props.synopsis: Two British surveillance aircraft have flown a 12-hour mission alongside US and NATO forces to patrol the Russian border.

title.children: UK and US join forces to patrol NATO's border with Russia

image.altText: A young girl sits in a field touching her ear and holds out her hand.

props.synopsis: Fourteen-year-old Isla Steed has unique challenges as one of just four people in Australia diagnosed with CHOPS syndrome.

title.children: Only four people in Australia have been diagnosed with this rare disease

image.altText: A middle-aged blonde woman in glasses looks pensive as she sits at a laptop.

props.synopsis: Property analysts, brokers and banks report more borrowers are taking on big housing debts in their late 40s and 50s and, potentially, a retirement still saddled with mortgage repayments.

title.children: Mortgage holders may soon face similar dilemma to renters in retirement

image.altText: A man in a vibrant blue suit looks to his side and frowns

props.synopsis: The US military is moving forward with plans to build a dedicated facility in Idaho to train pilots from Qatar. But not everyone is happy.

title.children: Why Trump allies are at odds over Qatari military training facility

image.altText: 5 planes fly in the air with red white and blue gas tailing behind.

props.synopsis: Taiwan will build a new multi-layered air defence system called "T-Dome" to defend itself against enemy threats, President Lai Ching-te has said.

title.children: Taiwan unveils 'T-Dome' air defence system plans to counter China threat

image.altText: A plane engine filmed mid-flight above Broken Hill.

props.synopsis: A Broken Hill councillor was on a home-bound flight from Sydney when one of the plane's engines stopped mid-air, in an incident that was "terrifying at every stage".

title.children: Rex passenger describes 'terrifying' mid-air engine failure days after fire
